links.title: Parimutuel betting - Wikipedia
links.description: Parimutuel betting (from French Pari Mutuel ("mutual betting")) is a betting system in which all bets of a particular type are placed together in a pool; taxes and the "house-take" or "vigorish" are deducted, and payoff odds are calculated by sharing the pool among all winning bets. In some countries it is known as the Tote after the totalisator, which calculates and displays bets already made.

3. Telegram claims TLS protects messages.
4. 1:1 E2E is opt-in. 

I get that it’s a pleasant app. Not here to rant at you for using it. But the security issues are not FUD.”

links.title: Research Post: Cache Attacks on CTR_DRBG - Forgotten Assumptions
